ODA Inspiration Day 2024 - What a Day! ğŸ‰ Last week, ODA Inspiration Day took place, and what an incredible day it was! A huge thank you to all participants, speakers, hosts, and everyone involved for making it such a fantastic event ğŸ™ With the theme "Decoding Decisions," ODA Inspiration Day offered insightful discussions on decision-making in technology, leadership, and personal development. The day was hosted by actress and Mensa Award winner Selda Ekiz. Attendees gained valuable insights into AI and data analysis, strategies for better leadership decisions, and techniques to overcome cognitive biases and manage uncertainty. The event featured panel discussions, interactive workshops, and networking opportunities, providing participants with practical tools and inspiration to enhance their decision-making processes. ğŸŒŸ Also, Congratulations to all the winners of the ODA Awards 2024. ğŸ† Weâ€™re already looking forward to next year! ğŸš€ Here are a few highlights from the day! ğŸ“¸ Erik N.H Krafft, Krafftwork #ODANettverk #ODAInspirationday #leadthechangenge

ğŸ‰ CEO Roundtable 2024 was a success! ğŸ‰ Today, we gathered at the Oslo Concert Hall for our CEO Roundtable event before the ODA Inspiration Day kicked off, and it was nothing short of inspiring. We discussed navigating the future amidst technological advancements and challenges. A huge thank you to our speakers, Birgitte Bryne and Mie Caroline Holstad from Norges Bank Investment Management, Rikke Kragelund from Implement Consulting Group â€“ and to all CEOâ€™s and other C Suites attending, for engaging in discussion and knowledge sharing on such an important topic: Shaping Tomorrow. As leaders, you have the power to drive change, advocate for policies that foster equality, champion sustainable practices and support innovations that benefit society. May you continue leading the change and serving as a true role models, promoting diversity and inclusion within your network and beyond. ğŸ’¡ Key takeaways from this yearâ€™s CEO Roundtable: 1. Psychological Safety is crucial for innovation and resilience. 2. Empathetic Leadership enhances decision-making and team dynamics. 3. Both/And Thinking is important to find solutions that combine multiple benefits, like improving quality while reducing costs. Also, thanks to the eminent team from ODA Network that have made this event happen: Kine Dahl, Kainaat Qaiser Mir, Kristine Hofer NÃ¦ss, Silje Finnskog Jensen, Gunn Severinsen, Nina GrÃ¸svik Ã…dnanes, Jane Xia, Stine SelvikvÃ¥g, Eline Lindsten og Maiken Danielsen Mandal, and Dag Fredrik BjÃ¸rnland from Implement Consulting Group ğŸ’« ğŸ“· all photos: NewsLab AS
